p: D.L. McCowan being first duly sworn, deposes and says: That on the 28th day of Feb. 1884, in said city of Seattle said defendant did violate Ordinance No. 32 of said city as follows, to-wit:

By being a person able to work and support himself in an honest and respectable calling, not having the wherewith to maintain himself, who is found loitering and stroeting about the streets of the city, who is an idle, dissolute person and has no regular lawful business or occupation; who does lead an idle, immoral, profhjoke course of life contrary to the term of the Statute said ordinance in such case made and provided, and against the peace and dignity of said city. Wherefore depondent prays that said Jack McLaine may be brought before this Court and be dealt with according to law.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 28th day of February 1884
